markdownRemark.html: Located in golf‘s golden mile between the Guadiaro River and the Sotogrande Marina, the course was inaugurated in 1964. The layout has well-established vegetation with pine, cork oaks, eucalyptus and palm trees, and water hazards play an important role, affecting holes 12, 13 and 14, and 16 and 17. The club hosts the annual Sherry Cup-European Amateur Golf Masters.

frontmatter.title: Real Club de Golf Sotogrande
frontmatter.description: Real Club de Golf Sotogrande - Located in golf‘s golden mile between the Guadiaro River and the Sotogrande Marina, the course was inaugurated in 1964. The layout has well-established vegetation with pine, cork oaks, eucalyptus and palm trees, and water hazards play an important role, affecting holes 12, 13 and 14, and 16 and 17. The club hosts the annual Sherry Cup-European Amateur Golf Masters.
frontmatter.address: Paseo del Parque s/n, 11310 Sotogrande, Cádiz, Spain
frontmatter.price: Highest green fee weekdays 160.00 euros, Highest green fee weekends 160.00 euros
